captions.text:
What's going on everybody and welcome to a
brand new series on the Smitegame YouTube channel.

My name is Trendkill and this is
Know Your Enemy.

Now before we get into the video I want to
make a note that this intro is going to be

a lot longer than they're going to be in future
videos but I wanted to make sure I clarified

a few things.
First things first, this is a beginner video,

so if you're experienced, if your level 30
and you've got a thousand games under your

belt this is not the video series for you.
We're going to be focusing on player from

like level 1 to 10 or 15.
So if you're beyond that or you think you

know enough about the game where a beginner
guide may not help you then go ahead and click out now.
But if you still want to stick around and

listen then lets talk about the series.
So a little back story

I've introduced several of my personal friends
to SMITE and every time I've tried to help

them get into it.
I've noticed they're lacking one basic piece

of knowledge
and that is; they have no clue what the other

gods in the game do
They focussed on one specific god because

they found out, "Hey I like this god" then
they stuck to that god

So they don't learn anything else about any
of the other gods

But what this does is; unfortunately, it puts
them at a disadvantage because they don't

know what the other gods are capable of.
So they have no clue when to initiate a fight

or when to run away.
And this series is supposed to shed light

on those gods so that you know what they are
capable of without having to go through and

play every god multiple times.
Did Neith just use her backflip?

She's probably vulnerable.
Is Athena's taunt on cooldown?

That means she's got no more crowd control.
And we're going to talk about several other

things that may lead into you thinking outside
of the box when it comes to fighting the enemy team.
Now another bonus to this video is that yes,

I'm giving you information on how to play
against a god, but that doesn't mean you can't

reverse that information and use it to your
advantage.

Maybe the enemy team hasn't watched this video
and in that case you have the upper hand.

Alright so now you guys know a little bit
about the series

You know what to expect from future episodes
But I want to make sure you know a few basic things first.
Over here you're going to find a link to a

playlist
It's going to show you a few beginner's guides

that I've created
Those are going to explain the very basic

core mechanics of the game and they're going
to define some terms that I may use in these

videos that you may not understand unless
you watch these first

So either have a firm grasp of basic MOBA
terminology or go watch these beginner guides

and get caught up.
The second thing I want to make sure you are

doing is that in addition to watching these
videos please go back and read the gods' abilities

as well
These videos are going to assume that you

at least know the basic information about
the gods' kits

Cooldown times, damages, do the abilities
fire in a strait line or are they ground targeted

AOE abilities.
In this series we are going to talk about

the advanced feature of the abilities and
the importance of those features in relation

to the god's kit.
But I don't have time to talk about all of

the basic information
These are supposed to be short videos

So, finally I say they are supposed to be
short videos and here we are with like a 3

minute intro
But we're ready to get into the video that

you guys came here to watch
Are you ready to Know Your Enemy?

Today we're going to be talking about Neith,
The Weaver of Fate

Alright, so lets go ahead and dive right in
The first thing your going to see in each

of these videos is a quick visual representation
of what each god is good at.

So let's start at the top and we'll go around
clockwise and kind of give a brief definition

of each of these categories
Damage is obviously how much damage that god

is capable of doing
Mobility is going to show you how easy its

going to be for that god to get into team
fights or get out of them if they are in trouble,

and also their ability to get around the map
quickly

Utility is going to show you how many things
that god can do in just 4 abilities, so if

a god has several status effects they can
apply on each of their abilities they're going

to have a high utility
Defense is obviously going to show you how

well they defend against attacks
Healing, like damage, is very strait forward.

This is the amount of healing potential this
god's going to have

You can see Neith is kind of floating around
the middle of the graph, that's because she

only has a self-heal
Somebody that can heal not only themselves

but also the rest of their team is going to
be much higher in this category

And Finally, Control is going to show you
how well a god can crowd control their enemies

So, the purpose of this graph is to really
give you a quick visual representation of

what the god's good at so you can glance right
now and see that Neith is a much more controlling

and utility based hunter than she is a god
that is going to come in and blow your face

off with damage.
Alright so now that we know what Neith's good

at lets take a look at some of the more intricate
details of her kit and maybe not intricate

details but some of the things you may not
have understood or missed the first time you

read her abilities' descriptions
The first thing you need to understand about

Neith is that her kit is built around her
passive called broken weave

Essentially any time an enemy god dies or
Neith uses her backflip a weave is placed

on the ground in that location
Those weaves then interact with her first

and second abilities and add secondary effects
to those abilities.

So for instance her first ability is called
Spirit Arrow

It is a strait shot projectile ability that
damages and roots everything that it goes

through
But when you shoot your Spirit Arrow through

a broken weave, that broken weave detonates
and explodes in a much larger area of effect

Not only that but the damage that the Spirit
Arrow would have normally done is then doubled

So you can see by integrating a broken weave
into that ability it drastically changes what

that ability does.
The other ability that interacts with Neith's

weaves is her second ability called Unravel
This is an AOE ground targeted ability that

damages all enemies in the AOE and also heals
Neith from up to three targets that were caught

in the ability.
Now I wanted to make sure we talked about

this one because this ability in particular
does several things that you may have missed

your first time reading through its description
For starters a lot of people may not know

that this ability de-buffs the attack speed
of all enemies hit by 30%

Also this ability will heal from weaves that
are in the same area for double what you would

heal from a single enemy
And in addition to that it adds to the total

of how many things you can heal from
So in a scenario where there are 2 weaves

on the ground and an enemy wave coming towards
those weaves, Neith can use her Unravel on

that entire wave, damaging the whole wave,
healing from 3 of the minions, and in addition

to the minions, healing from 2 broken weaves
Now one last thing about weaves, if you are

playing Neith your weaves show up on the ground
as a small blue circle

If the enemy team has a Neith, her weaves
will show up on the ground as a small red

circle
Which will help you always be cognizant of

which weaves are in play when you're fighting
an enemy Neith

So when it comes to knowing your enemy, remember
that Neith has a ton of tools in her kit that

she can use to her advantage
In just 4 abilities she has a root, a heal,

an attack speed de-buff, a slow, all of the
weaves that are in play, and a global ultimate

So if played properly Neith can be a very
formidable foe.

Alright, so in the mechanics section what
we're going to be doing is looking at things

you're going to want to watch out for as your
playing up against and enemy Neith

These are more advanced tactics or things
that are not inherently obvious by reading

the description of the abilities
Also remember that these mechanics and tips

can be reversed and used to your advantage
if you happen to be the one playing Neith

Alright, so the first tip I've got is about
Spirit Arrow, remember that this ability can

be fired through walls
This is not obvious based on reading the description

So remember if you are low on life or you
happen to be running for your life, you're

not safe if you are separated from Neith by
a wall because she can still shoot through

that wall and either kill you or root you
to give her more time to get around that obstacle.

Another thing we need to be watching out for
is her ability to shoot her broken weaves

with her spirit arrow
Remember those explode with a large AOE, so

you need to always be aware of how large or
approximately how large those AOE explosions are.
If you're trying to take advantage of an enemy

Neith's poor positioning she's instinctual
going to Backflip.

Well remember, the Backflip lays a weave on
the ground

She can shoot that weave and root both you
and your support as well as dealing double

the damage she would have done had you not
been standing in that AOE

So always remember what causes weaves to be
created and what Neith can do to those weaves

so you don't get caught off guard.
Alright, so lets move on and talk about Unravel

This one ability
Lets say happen to be boxing an enemy Neith,

Which is essentially fighting her 1v1
If you guys are both similar farm, similar

level, similar experience with the god, odds
are either one of you could win

However, if she uses her Unravel on you that
will de-buff your attack speed, damage you,

and heal her
That one ability can greatly turn the tied

of battle if you had not prepared for those
things to happen

So always remember what that ability can actually
do to you

Another thing that people don't necessarily
think about when it comes to the heal part

of her unravel is that if you happen to be
chasing an enemy Neith through the Jungle

she can use her unravel on a Jungle camp from
outside of the aggro range of that camp to

heal from it without taking the risk of taking
damage from the camp itself

So that can really turn the tides of a chase
through the Jungle
Alright, now lets move on to her third ability, Backflip

This is an extremely versatile ability in
the fact that is does several different things

for her
Now we've already discussed this, I'm going

to touch on it extremely briefly
Remember, when she Backflips she places a

weave on the ground
That weave can then be used to extremely quickly

clear a wave of minions
so she's got some pretty decent wave clear

Now in addition to that, remember, it is still an AOE
explosion that can damage and root you so

you've got to be very careful around
Neith when she's clearing a wave.

Another thing is that when she is in the air
using her Backflip

she is completely immune to damage so it is
a way to get her out of problematic situations

So don't be surprised if you throw everything
that you've got at Neith and she simply Backflips

out of it completely unscathed
The last few tips I have for you are about

her ultimate called World Weaver
First off, a couple of things that are not

mentioned in the description
One, Neith has to have mini-map vision of

an enemy to be able to lock on to them
Now this vision can be supplied by minions,

or towers, or wards, or teammates
Anything that will highlight Neith on the

mini-map
So if you are playing against a Neith and

you happen to be low on life and you are anticipating
her to shoot you from across the map with

World Weaver then make sure you get away from
anything that could potentially highlight

you on the map
Run away from towers and enemy minions, and

anyplace you think they may have wards
Try not to stand by the enemy team

Another thing is that if you are targeted
you and everybody else in the game will be

able to see that you are targeted and will
be able to see from which direction the World

Weaver is coming
Another thing that is not mentioned in the

description is that just because Neith has
locked onto you does not mean that you are

guaranteed to be hit by that arrow
Your support can stand in between you and

where the arrow is coming from and intercept
the damage and the stun for you

The same goes for if you are playing a support
you want to always be aware that Neith has

the ability to shoot your team
and always be prepared to intercept that damage

The last thing that you want to worry about
and this is in the description but it is still

worth mentioning
is that Neith does not have to charge her

Ultimate to the full charge to be able to
get a stun on you

It will do reduced damage and a shorter stun
time but that short stun time may be just

enough for Neith's team to catch up to you
and finish you off

so if you are at low life or you are in a
fight and you are on the mini-map, you are

in no way safe at any time if the enemy team
has a Neith

So there you have it guys
hopefully I've not wasted too much of your

time
You've learned a lot about Neith and now you

feel a little more comfortable fighting her
on the Battleground of the Gods

So thanks for watching guys, again my name
is Trendkill and I will see you next week

on Know Your Enemy when we talk about Ymir,
The Father of the Frost Giants
